DOC.brief_summary: Introduction : Low back pain one common complaint doctor ' office , acute low back pain characterize episode pain less three week duration . The transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation ( TENS ) , base gate control theory pain propose Melzack Wall 1965 , use adjunctive therapy control back pain , non-invasive , low cost , safe easy apply . No study find regard effectiveness TENS acute low back pain . Objective : To evaluate effectiveness TENS pain management patient acute low back pain . Material Methods : A randomized clinical trial , double-blinded placebo-controlled . Patients select clinic Federal de University Sao Paulo ( UNIFESP ) accord follow criterion : acute low back pain , gender , age 18 65 year , pain 4 8cm pain numeric scale ( PNS ) agree participate study . After sign informed consent patient randomly allocate one group : TENS group ( TG ) Placebo Group ( PG ) . In TG apply conventional TENS frequency intensity variation ( FIV ) effect , frequency 100 hertz , pulse width 60Î¼s intensity adjust accord individual baseline patient without cause muscular contraction . The electrode arrange cross shape paravertebral region ( level T12-L1 L5 - S1 ) . In PG procedure adopt , occur electrical stimulus . Patients inform could could feel electric shock . Treatment consist 10 session ( 2x / week / 5 week ) , session last 30 ' . Assessments make follow time : T0 ( baseline ) , T1 T10 ( begin end session ) , T11 ( last session ) , T30 ( 30 day last session ) T60 ( 60 day last session ) . Assessment tool : PNS pain , short-form 36 ( SF-36 ) , Roland-Morris , self-assessment improvement ( `` Likert '' scale ) drug consumption ( daily ) .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Patients With Acute Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: acute low back pain gender age 18 65 year pain 4 8cm PNS ( pain numeric scale ) agree participate study .
